snippet: Six lawmakers have let Republican House leaders know that they oppose oil drilling in the Alaskan wildlife refuge, possibly signaling that a moderate wing may be emerging.
abstract: Six lawmakers have let Republican House leaders know that they oppose oil drilling in the Alaskan wildlife refuge, possibly signaling that a moderate wing may be emerging.
lead_paragraph: Since Republicans took control of the House last year, their leaders have had to deal with near-constant revolts from their Tea Party-infused right flank. But with elections looming, opposition may now be stirring on their left from members in swing districts.

headline.main: Moderate Republicans Spotted in the House?
